newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: CRICKET-E.PROVINCE 221-6 AT CLOSE AGAINST NATAL.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-E.PROVINCE 221-6 AT CLOSE AGAINST NATAL.

text.p: Two suicidal run outs marred Eastern Province's day as they struggled to 221 for six at the close on the first day of the Supersport series match against Natal at St George's Park on Friday.
Batting first after winning the toss, only E.P. skipper Kepler Wessels with 61 and Louis Koen with 43 were able to make totals of substance.
Two setbacks for E.P. came when Dave Callaghan and Grant Morgan were run out after excellent fielding by Errol Stewart and Jonty Rhodes.
The homes side were dealt another blow in the closing stages when Mark Rushmere, on 36, was forced to retire after being hit on the head folllowing a short ball from Tertius Bosch.
The outstanding bowler for Natal was Neil Johnson who bowled his medium pacers with accuracy to claim two for 22.
To bat: Quentin Ferreria, Mornantau Hayward
Bowling: Gilder 15-2-61-1, Bosch 20-6-41-0, Johnson 14.2-3-22-2, Crookes 18-4-47-0, Symcox 12-0-34-0, Benkenstein 2-0-11-1.
Griqualand West: Mickey Arthur (captain), Martyn Gidley, Wayne Schonegevel, Pieter Barnard, Willie Dry, Ralph Koster, Cedric English, Wendell Bossenger, Brett Benkenstein, Vaughn Walsh, Garth Roe.
